Antonin Brun
About me
I am a first-year civil engineering PhD student at i-lab, part of the Viterbi School of Engineering at USC, working on Human-Building Interaction. I am advised by Burçin Becerik-Gerber.

I am passionate about wellbeing in the built environment, building energy efficiency, and intelligent occupant-centred design.

I have an MS in Civil and Environmental Engineering (focus in Sustainable Design and Construction) from Stanford University where I was a graduate researcher for Catherine Gorlé and a public speaking teaching assistant for Matt Vassar (ENGR103/203). I also have a B.Eng. in Bioresource Engineering from McGill University.
abrun[at]usc[dot]edu

    Antonin Brun, Mohamad Awada, Burçin Becerik-Gerber

    EG-ICE
    Toward Occupant-Centric Virtual Agents: Office Workers’ Perspectives on Technological Design and Implementation

    Antonin Brun, Burçin Becerik-Gerber
    International Workshop on Intelligent Computing in Engineering, 2024
    PDF


    Through a set of focus groups, we identified ways office workers benefit from their data and how they relate with respect to their stress. We highlight design recommendations for occupant-centric virtual agents to support office workers in understanding their data and connecting with their archictectural space.


    Adapted from Leonid Keselman's fork of John Barron's website.

    Antonin Brun 2024.
